roleset.name: cast an image back, casting back an image
roleset.note: REFLECT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'reflect' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus. (from reflect.01-v predicate notes)
REFLECTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on updated reflect-v.01. No corresponding VNcls. (from reflection.01-n)

example.name: literal, active
example.text: The mirror reflected the enormous zit on John's nose.
example.arg: the enormous zit on John's nose

example.text: [The enormous zit on John's nose]-1 was reflected [*-1]by the mirror.

example.name: metaphorical
example.text: The protracted downturn reflects the intensity of Bank of Japan's yen-support intervention.
example.arg: the intensity of Bank of Japan's yen-support intervention.

example.name: metaphorical, passivized
example.text: [The upbeat mood of stocks]-1 was reflected [*-1]in demand for futures contracts.

example.name: reflect on
example.text: John's recent behavior reflects poorly on his ability to live alone.
example.arg: on his ability to live alone

example.name: just arg2
example.text: That they retain Korean citizenship and ties is a reflection of history

example.name: arg1 as mirror
example.text: No, the color of a mirror does not affect its reflection of light.

example.name: both args again
example.text: A wooden boat's beauty lies in its reflection of nature.

roleset.name: think about
roleset.note: REFLECT-V NOTES: VN class marvel-31.3-8. Might also be phrasal "reflect_on", if that's in the lexicon. (from reflect.02-v)
REFLECTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on reflect-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls marvel-31.3-8. (from reflection.02-n)

example.name: think about
example.text: John-1 was ordered to sit in the corner and *trace*-1 reflect on his actions.

example.name: both args
example.text: Mr. Lu 's reflections on 6 years as a cancer sufferer in China .
example.arg: on 6 years as a cancer sufferer in China

example.name: oblique arg0
example.text: The reflections of the President were very helpful
